Reviews.Title: “Nice and cosy”
Reviews.Author: Ninnadj
Reviews.Content: Very cute place to stay in the centre of Venice. Great location between the train station and Mark's Square. Lady that works there is also polite and helpful. The room that we had is obviously quite old, but clean and with charm.. Looks very vintage. The sheets, floors and sharing bathroom were also very clean. For a very good price on a weekday during the Carnival in February, breakfast and Internet were included. Venice has introduced a tourist tax so depending on the length of the stay you will pay a bit extra to the room charge. In the booking confirmation e-mail from hotel Alex the amount was 0,50E per person per day, but eventually we paid 1,00E with the explanation it is the charge in high season. Just a detail to be aware of. Everything else was great. There is even a supermarket right in front where you can get a snack for the center sightseeing (there are not many of them around Mark's square).

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Luckett79
Reviews.Content: We paid a premium price for this room as it was over new years, but normally for a 1 star hotel this place is quite adequate. You need to keep in mind this place is 1 star! The room was big, clean but NOISY. The locks on the doors are so loud it will wake anyone up on the same floor coming in and out of your room. The shared facilities were ok. The shower was very small and needed a good clean. The breakfast was adequate and the lady that worked at reception was lovely and very helpful. There was another man there but we didn't have anything to do with him. Good location, about 10 minute walk to Rialto bridge and a supermarket right across from hotel. There is also free wifi but they turn it off sometimes. Keeping in mind that this is a 1 star hotel I would stay here again..... depending on price. But they MUST do something about he locks on the doors.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for...... although probably not in Venice!!”
Reviews.Author: PCBrooksy
Reviews.Content: This is a one star hotel and is definately worthy of its rating. We were not expecting a lot but its the added negatives that made our stay unpleasant. While it is clean, the rooms are large and the position of the hotel is central, there are a number of things which we weren't aware of with the hotel prior to staying there. The price is low for Venice but still considerably more than other european city's for what you get. Beware of the reasonably good review on Lonely Planet!! (that was what made us book this Hotel). Our first floor room was extremely noisy - noise in the street until 3am and then from 7am again, impossible to sleep. Paper thin inside walls. The ceramic floor tiles in our room weren't even glued down and moved about as you walked on them. Very dodgy bedside lamps which looked like they were an electrical fault waiting to happen and which caused a severe burn to my wifes arm. Mosquito ridden room with squashed mosquito's all over the walls and did not seem to ever be cleaned off. You can't open the bedroom windows for the mossie problem and you can't open the bedroom door to let fresh air in as the foyer has an extremely strong smell of cigarette smoke (despite being a non smoking hotel!!!). The furniture in the room is quite old but ok except for the beds. My children slept on single fold out beds which had mattresses which were banana shaped and not very good for sleeping on. I stress again that it is clean and large rooms plus the grandma on the front desk is particulalry helpful, although her son? Mario not so much. You are promised free wifi but for the life of us couldn't get it to work anywhere in the hotel despite the owners insisting they gave us the password. Overall, particulalry disappointed that reviews in Lonely Planet don't mention the noise and bedroom/issues. It is well located, but I'd stay somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Book only as a last resort”
Reviews.Author: Infinite_voyage
Reviews.Content: The location is really the strong point of this hotel. We were in a jam for a room and ended up paying 75 Euro/night for a teensy weensy garret on the top floor. The decor was definitely starting to show it's age and the furniture was probably at least 20 years old if not older, and not in a charming antique sort of way. The shared bathroom also wasn't the cleanest - especially the shower which was very small. The lady at the front desk is quite nice, but that alone isn't enough to merit a recommendation. If you do have to stay here, and/or happen to be in the neighbourhood, there is a great little grocery store across from the hotel which is a rare sight in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best choice...”
Reviews.Author: RenaissanceArtLover
Reviews.Content: While Hotel Alex gets a 5 star rating for location, it's not the greatest B&B for comfort. Located in the San Polo region of Venice, it's a short walk to the Grand Canal, many shops and restaurants, but then again, most of Venice is that way. No matter where you stay, all areas of the small city of Venice can be reached easily on foot. The hospitality at Hotel Alex was ok, but the owners were not there much. The morning continental breakfast was less than adequate...though there is a nice, little general store right across the sidewalk that we used to supplement our breakfasts each morning. Our room, though quite large, lacked hot water, soap, and clean soft towels. The towels were "hard" and gave my daughter a facial rash. The toilet area, and the single, shower room were shared between 4 guestrooms. I found it inconvenient. While the bed was comfortable, I could expect to be awoken at 3am each morning by the loud crowd leaving the local bars nearby. The price was definitely right, but not worth the inconvenience...If you are looking for a good location at a good price, Hotel Alex is for you; otherwise, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe I am getting too old for shared bathrooms.”
Reviews.Author: Becca1979
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because it was the last room in Venice in our price range on Easter weekend, so beggars can't be choosers. However, the price tag on this room was the equivalent of other small B&B and guest houses in the area, which all had private bathrooms and larger rooms. This place was more like a backpacker lodge without the cheaper price tag. I actually had mentally prepared for the shared bathrooms, but they turned out to be so tiny you could hardly change clothes and there was only one shower per two floors. I have had better shared bathrooms in far cheaper youth hostels. Our room did have a very nice terrace that we enjoyed immensely. However, Lonely Planet mistakenly said the terraces on 3 sides of the building had canal views, this is wrong, there is no way any side of this building would have a canal view. The location was nice, an easy walk from the arrival point at Piazza Roma and an easy walk to the Rialto bridge. If you need a place to stay and this is your only option, that's fine, but you can do better if you book ahead somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Very good for a one star hotel”
Reviews.Author: ByeByeBlues7
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 5 (en suite double room) on the second floor for 2 nights & I now think that Hotel Alex is a little gem. However it is still a one star hotel, so the following needs to be stated: NEGATIVES: - uncomfortable bed Our double bed was made of 2 twin beds put together, which therefore created a gap in the middle. One materass was ok, but the other one lost its shape ages ago.. - Noisy. You can hear everything that goes on outside your door & as it is an old building with no double glazed windows, you can hear everything that goes on in the street too, starting from 6:30 am (we managed to sleep until late anyway, though!) - You can only pay by cash. POSITIVES - Great location, right in the middle of Venice. - Old, charming building. - Ample rooms. Plenty of space. - Very clean!! - the owner (an elderly lady) is really lovely & helpful. - Great views from the windows. - 120 Euros per night, which is a moderate rate for central Venice in high season. I can't comment on the breakfast, because we never made it. Overall a good experience. I would recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, run down, no frills but central”
Reviews.Author: Iluvtotravel44
Reviews.Content: In Venice accommodation is expensive. I paid in holiday season 50 Euros (single) without breakfast so I wasn't expecting much and it is a rather run down hotel. Top floor (stairs only) room for one person with shared bathroom. Room was small but clean and bed comfortable. I had a small outside balcony which was okay for close roof top views. Provided with a towel and bed linen on bed, Extra pillow and blanket in wardrobe, washbasin and a bedside lamp. Centrally located with a small supermarket across the road and a good restauant for an evening meal also across the road. An easy 10 min walk to train and bus station. More than 30 minites by vaporetto to S. Toma from Piazalle Roma (water bus area). You can leave heavy luggage at bus station or train station as walking is essential and some bridges are steep.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, basic, incredibly inexpensive for Venice”
Reviews.Author: MarilynPortland
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of March for a staggeringly low 47 Euros per might. We asked for a quiet room and were given a top floor room w/ great windows and a bit of a balcony. I found it clean and homey. The lovely woman who runs it makes you feel like you're just in a room in her house, and that may be the case. Part of its charm is how "dated" it is. The breakfast was basic. But the room was huge, the windows and view over the street was great, and the location was fabulous; an easy (10 minute?) walk from the train station. I would recommend it for someone on a budget and who could recognize the charm. (Right across the a little grocery; very convenient) Radiator heat; great for drying clothes.

Reviews.Title: “Could have done better”
Reviews.Author: PETERJILL
Reviews.Content: Directions to hotel hopeless , welcolm from Mario unpleasent <mother nice>good position room ok breakfast very basic but acceptable , other properties in the area appear to be just as good but much better value,not the most pleasant of stays.

Reviews.Title: “basic hotel, old decor and low standard of cleaning and breakfast, location good”
Reviews.Author: kakatua
Reviews.Content: After a three night stay I cannot recommended this run down hotel. In Venice on the same trip we stayed in cleaner and cheaper bed and breakfast than this hotel. Its standard of cleaning was poor, no aircon and the breakfast was not worth the extra. Better to buy some fresh rolls and juice from the supermarket which is opposite. We booked for 4 nights only to be told on arrival we had to move on the last night, which wasted half a day of precious time in Venice. Note they only take cash!

Reviews.Title: “Totally crap - don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: AAteamNSW
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just gross. We paid for a room with an ensuite which was not available when we arrived so were given the shared bathroom option. Which would of been fine, except that it was the most filthy, mouldy bathroom we had ever seen. The staff were rude, breakfast was totally crap and we had to wait over 1/2 an hour to let us into the hotel upon arriving off a long plane flight. I would not stay here ever. Very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: caityandyvonne
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I chose this hotel for a 3 night stay knowing it was a budget option but were guided by trip advisor reviews.We were very happy with our welcome but it appears the nonna who not only ran the desk and also provided the breakfast could do with some help. (We did not see any cleaning staff during our stay). We had a double room with a shared external bathroom. The shower room was very small but more importantly not clean with mould on the very low ceiling and shower door ,the grouting needed a good scrub.The walls of our room were grubby and basically needed a scrub and a fresh coat of paint. There was also what appeared to be mould down the lenght of the wall in one corner We had a non smoking room but there was constantly the strong smell of cigarettes inside the hotel. In my 18 year old daughters words Grotty!

Reviews.Title: “We rented 5 rooms”
Reviews.Author: speedycc
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because it was one of the least expensive hotels we could find for our extended family trip. We booked 5 rooms (2 doubles and 3 quads) We were very happy with the location. The rooms were not air conditioned and only one fan was supplied per quad room. Some of the quad rooms had a lot of airflow through the windows but our particular room had only one window and was stifling hot with only one fan for the four of us. Some of the pillows were just chunks of foam crammed into a pillow case - awful. I was asked to wire 1/2 of the total deposit to the hotel 4 months in advance, which I did. I received 3 e-mails from the hotel each confirming that I wired a different amount of money - clearly they had some accounting issues. When I got there I was also told that the hotel would only take cash for the remaining amount owed and that I had to pay an additional 50 euros to cover the hotel's wiring fees. This was not made clear to me when I originally wired the money. Fifty Euros seems like an outrageous fee for wiring money. Make sure you understand all the fees/ costs upfront.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, Clean and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: pinkyNewDelhi
Reviews.Content: The best thing about Hotel Alex is that because it's been around for so long, most people seem to know where it is. Since, you'll be getting lost in Venice quite frequently, this is a huge advantage. Sometimes, the locals are even willing to come along with you to help you find your way. It's also very clean and the lady who wan running the place while we were there, was extremely friendly. But the rooms are a tad old fashioned with the bedspreads looking like they've been around for ever. If you're a light sleeper, you'll also have problems with the noise since it's situated on a pretty common thoroughfare and has people walking around all through the night. But, it's an easy half-hour walk to St Mark's Square and is also walkable from the station.

Reviews.Title: “Best deal in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: Kalthor
Reviews.Content: Finding cheap, decent accomodation in Venice is close to impossible. After reading the reviews on this page regarding Hotel Alex I decided to give it a go. On arrival we were greeted by a very sweet old lady and were shown to our rooms. We were only able to get a single room since everything else was booked out, we decided to still go ahead and they moved an extra bed in there for us. The room turned out to be quite small but very cozy. We had our own room but had to share bathroom and shower with three other rooms on that floor, and during the three nights we stayed there we never had any problems with it. The included breakfast was small but typical Italian with croissants and coffee. The area is perfect, quiet and nice, it's only around 10min walk to the train station and Piazzale Roma and only another 10-15min to San Marco (unless you get lost =)) We paid â‚¬60 per night, in Venice.... that's a VERY good deal!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good, especially for the price”
Reviews.Author: miketravel100
Reviews.Content: Hotel Alex was pretty good for the price. We stayed a few days during our honeymoon and were fairly impressed. The room was large and clean and had a balcony where we sat and read every night. There's a good gelato and pizza place pretty close by. I didn't care for Venice as much as I thought I would, but I thought the Hotel Alex was more than a fair value (especially when looking at how much other Venice hotels cost).

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Alex - great value!”
Reviews.Author: tonyriccardi
Reviews.Content: Myself and my fiance stayed in Venice for two nights, and I expected everything to be very expensive in and around the S. Marco area. So I took a chance with Hotel Alex and decided to stay in this one star establishment in the S. Polo area of the city. And the chance paid off. Everything in S. Marco is more expensive as expected - accomodation, food, drink, bird seed. Not only was Hotel Alex more cost effective than most parts of Venice, the traditional rooms were clean and comfortable. Plus we had a lovely view leading straight down the front path and onto the canal. Plus the bars and restaurants around S. Polo were much cheaper than in S. Marco, and it also gave us the perfect opportunity to explore (and get lost) around this part of the city - which we would have otherwise ignored if we had stayed in S. Marco. No major issues, as myself and my partner have a pretty good attitude when it comes to travelling abroad. I think that the hot water ran out once but a cold shower after 6 hours of walking in the heat was welcomed! Quite a bit of noise from the late nighters walking by - but we were in one of the busiest cities in the world so it had to be expected. No aircon available, but nothing a cold shower couldnt sort out - the buildings in Venice are old and S. Polo is a more traditional part of the city than the tourist saturated S. Marco - a big aircon unit in the corner, with all the windows shut would have taken the charm away from our room. All in all a good experience. Not only would I recommend travellers to consider staying away from S. Marco, I would definately recommend Hotel Alex.

Reviews.Title: “Good location could do with a clean up”
Reviews.Author: blueyedpuss
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Alex with my partner for two nights. I realise that hotels in Venice are very expensive, but this was good value at â‚¬104 per night for the two of us. Our room was number 9 on the top floor and bear in mind there are no lifts. The room is very basic, bed, bedside tables, a wardrobe, dressing table and chair, however our room had a small balcony with two chairs and as we were on the top floor the window could be kept wide open all night. The bed was also very comfortable. We didn't bother with breakfast, although it was included in the price. The ensuite bathroom appeared to be reasonably newly decorated, however there were a few problems. The shower tiles, pull cord for the shower and the shower head were quite mildewed and were in need of a good scrub. There was a soap dispenser over the sink, which was empty and no other soap was supplied. Having said all that, the towels, bed linen and the rest of the room were all very clean. I must also add that the loo had a proper seat, something I found to be lacking in a lot of loos in Venice!!! As I was only staying two nights, and considering the cost of the room in comparison to prices in Venice, I was prepared to put up with this. The location is also very convenient and off the beaten tourist track so restaurants in the area were much nicer and cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Great economical hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was afraid that I would not be able to stay in Venice because all of the hotels I researched were so expensive. Then I found the Hotel Alex. It was wonderful. Mario and his mother were very helpful with anything that I needed or wanted. The breakfast was not huge, but it was very good, and I did not go away hungry. It is located in an area that is quieter from a tourist standpoint. I could go to busy Rialto and busy San Marco, then return this quiet neighborhood. Admittedly, there was some street noise at night, but I counted that as part of my experience. There is a grocery store right across the street and also a bar. Easy and interesting walk from Vapareto stop San Tomas. There was a sink in the room only--toilet was on the same floor, shower was a room below. My room had a cool balcony. I would definitely stay at Hotel Alex again and tell my friends.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem”
Reviews.Author: lareve
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a four night stay at this little hotel/pension. Mario and his family made us feel very welcome. The room was spotless and of a good size, ok the furniture was old but it was Venitian! Our little balcony overlooked the street with a side view of the canel. Breakfast was the usual croissants ect, with wonderful italian coffee, basic but enough to kick start the day. The location was excellent, 10 mins from the bus station and Rialto bridge. Another plus point, as its not deemed to be in the main tourist area eateries were substantialy cheaper and the food excellent ( as was Venice ) would definately return.

Reviews.Title: “A Warm & Friendly Place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very nice room with a great view of the street. The owners were very helpful and were always there to answer any of are questions. We go to Venice twice a year and have found the place we will stay at in the Hotel Alex.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good For The Price”
Reviews.Author: SoFLGringo
Reviews.Content: Nothing fancy about this place, paid 40 euros for a single room on the top floor in December 2005. The place seemed very clean. My room even had a balcony. Shared bath on the same floor and shared shower one floor below. Plenty of heat and hot water. Breakfast minimal but what do you expect. Bed comfort was adequate. Location is excellent, a bit off the beaten track but close to the vaporetto and near the Frari church. Restaurants are close by. The staff was completely pleasant. Not sure I would return just because I am starting to like my little luxuries in old age.

Reviews.Title: “A Disappointing Experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent a weekend at the Hotel Alex in Venice and the entire experience was a disappointing one. We went there knowing it was a one-star hotel and expected spartan-like accomodation (which it was) but I must say it is undeserving of even that one little star. The comforter on the bed was filthy, there was very little hot water and though they advertise heating in the rooms, we spent our nights chattering under the dirty covers. We have been living in Europe for the past two years and have spent many a night at one-star hotels, but have never had an unfortunate experience like this one. Upon leaving, we went to collect the deposit we had paid in advance. Unfortunately, we made the mistake of paying them with an American Express Money Order made out to the Hotel Alex. The owner assured us he would mail us a refund because only they could cash this check. Despite repeated efforts to contact the hotel regarding our 100 Euros, we have never received our repayment nor a response. This is an unprofessional and dishonest establishment located in a beautiful and memorable city. Do yourselves a favor and opt for other accomodation...it's too great a city to let the experience be hampered by a hotel such as this.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Alex
HotelInfo.Address: 2606, S. Polo, 30124 Venice, Italy
